column5: May 5 HighTower Advsiors LLC  an independent adviser-owned firm that has expanded by hiring away from top U.S. brokerages  said it has hired a team of veteran advisers from the Guth Group at Morgan Stanley to expand its presence in Columbus  Ohio.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Morgan Stanley hires advisers from UBS
column5: May 5 Morgan Stanley's wealth management unit said on Monday that it hired veteran advisers from UBS AG  for its Louisville office.

column4: Europe Factors to Watch-Shares set to inch up in thin volumes
column5: PARIS  May 5 European stocks were set to inch higher on Monday in thin volumes as UK markets were closed for a holiday  with gains set to be capped following soft Chinese manufacturing data.     At 0613 GMT  futures for Euro STOXX 50  for Germany's DAX  and for France's CAC were flat to up 0.2 percent.     The final reading of China's HSBC/Markit purchasing managers index (PMI) for April came in at 48.1  lower than a preliminary reading of 48.3 but up slightly from an eight-month low

column4: Novo cuts sales forecast after U.S. contract losses
column5: COPENHAGEN Denmark's Novo Nordisk A/S   the world's top maker of insulin  has lowered its 2014 sales outlook  hurt by the loss of two U.S. contracts and competition from copycat versions of its diabetes drug Prandin  it said on Thursday.

column4: Occidental Petroleum profit rises on higher crude  natgas prices
column5: May 5 Occidental Petroleum Corp  the fourth-largest U.S. oil and gas company  reported a 2.6 percent rise in first-quarter profit  helped by higher prices for crude oil and natural gas.

column4: BG  Shell push Brazil oil  gas output to 26-month high in March
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  May 5 Brazil's oil and natural gas output rose to a 26-month high in March as companies such as Royal Dutch Shell Plc and BG Group Plc made up for stagnant output from state-run oil company Petrobras  oil regulator ANP said on Monday.

column4: Itau tops Petrobras in Brazil stock index weightings
column5: SAO PAULO  May 5 Shares of Brazil's largest non-government bank  Itau Unibanco Holding SA now carry the heaviest weighting on the benchmark Bovespa stock index  topping state-run oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA  exchange operator BM&FBovespa SA  said on Monday.

column5: NEW YORK Pfizer Inc's top officials said on Monday they are weighing all strategies  including potential hostile maneuvers  in the company's effort to seal a $106 billion takeover of British drugmaker AstraZeneca Plc.

column5: BOSTON  May 5 Target Corp shareholder CtW Investment Group called on the retailer to separate the roles of chairman and chief executive after Monday's announcement that Chief Executive and Chairman Gregg Steinhafel is leaving the company.

column4: UPDATE 1-Australia April new vehicle sales hit by holidays
column5: (Adds to note Toyota is also set to close operations)     SYDNEY  May 5   Sales of new vehicles in Australia fell in April from a year earlier but largely because the month had fewer selling days this year  an industry report showed on Monday.     The Australian Federal Chamber of Automotive Industries' VFACTS report showed sales of 80 710  were down 5.2 percent on April last year. April this year had 2 fewer selling days  so sales per day actually increased from last year.     Sales

column4: Australia April new vehicle sales hit by holidays
column5: SYDNEY  May 5   Sales of new vehicles in Australia fell in April from a year earlier but largely because the month had fewer selling days this year  an industry report showed on Monday.     The Australian Federal Chamber of Automotive Industries' VFACTS report showed sales of 80 710  were down 5.2 percent on April last year. April this year had 2 fewer selling days  so sales per day actually increased from last year.     Sales in original terms were down 17 percent in April compared

column4: URGENT-Tyson sees pork production down as much as 4 pct this year
column5: May 5 Tyson Foods Inc on Monday said it expects industry pork production to be down as much as 4 percent this year  as heavier hog weights fail to completely offset the supply-reducing effects of a virus that is deadly to piglets.

column4: Tyson Foods' profit more than doubles as chicken sales rise
column5: May 5 Tyson Foods Inc  the largest U.S. meat processor  said its profit more than doubled in the second quarter  mainly due to strong demand for chicken.

column4: Allergan shareholder Ackman warns against pursuing deals beyond Valeant
